fields.name: Stakeholder Requirements Review and Design Plan Presentation
fields.description:
This source item captures the Stakeholder Requirements Review presentation.

 

MIRS​

  • Test solution shall program required files to the correct locations​

  • Test solution shall produce auditable programming records verifying the correct file was programmed into the correct location.​

  • Test solution verification shall include functional verification at a higher level to ensure programming was performed correctly.​

Technical Performance Measures​

  • Programming Time

fields.description: This document provides instructions for loading FPGA Configuration data into the Flash devices for the New HPIO CCA (828-1A60-001) IO and Processor FPGAs

fields.description: This document provides instructions for loading FPGA Configuration data into the flash of the EGDP CCA (2600-1760-002)

fields.name: 946-1128-001 for the Sensor Suite Controller (SSC) FPGA
fields.description: This document contains the setup and procedures for programming the Xilinx® Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) on the Sensor Suite Controller (SSC) for the Remote Vision System (RVS) Line Replaceable Unit (LRU), or on the SSC for the Enhanced Remote Vision System (ERVS) LRU.

fields.name: 946-1U70-001 for the LCD Controller FPGA

fields.name: System Requirements
fields.jurisdiction_classification$54: Build Part Number Jurisdiction Classification Country Identified

fields.name: Reference: Programming Hardware Interface
fields.description: The Xilinx Platform Cable USB II and the FlashPro 4 connect to a PC via USB. The PC USB connections supply communications and DC power to each programmer.

fields.name: Paddleboard Guide Pins
fields.description:
Test solution paddleboards that attach to the UUT shall include guide pins to protect the connector pins from damage.

 

NOTE: to protect the connector pins from damage when using paddleboards.

fields.name: All Applicability
fields.description: Requirements applicable to all projects

fields.name: *Safety Checklist Completion*
fields.description: The Test Solution shall comply with the Test Equipment Safety Checklist  074-8434-282.
fields.text4: Completion of the Test Equipment safety checklist is a requirement for test equipment release per HRC-OPS-I-752.
fields.validation_evidence$193: Completion of the Test Equipment safety checklist is a requirement for test equipment release per HRC-OPS-I-752. The requirement has been evaluated per Appendix B Requirements Validation Checklist in the Requirements Management Plan 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Test Data Archiving
fields.description:
The Test System shall generate and store test data outputs in TDMS.

 

NOTE: For specific projects, the specific data repository tool (TDMS/MES/etc.) required by the project should be specified here.

If the test station is off the network, capture portable storage or firewall requirements.
fields.text3: This often comes from the MEE on the program. Identify whether TDMS or another database needs to receive test logs.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Connector/Cable Mating Protection
fields.description: The Test System Hardware shall be designed so that cables cannot be reversed or plugged into the wrong connector.
fields.text3: Reversed cables can lead to damage to the UUT when power is applied or bent pins when the cables are mated. It is important to prevent this from occurring as this can lead to significant rework and repair being required on the production UUT in question. In some rare cases, the UUT may be scrapped due to the expected repair cost. However, in some cases where limited connector mates are available, this may not be practical. Therefore, it is critical to work with the design engineering team early on in this process for mates to the UUT.
fields.validation_evidence$193: See Rationale and also if not applicable, identify the reason such as the connector mates are not reversible and no alternative exists. In such cases, the requirement may be updated to indicate that special labels or other visual indicators are to be used to protect the UUT From damage. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Keyed Connectors/Cables
fields.description: All connectors and cables with keying shall be correctly keyed to their mating point.
fields.text3: Often times keying is wrong on connectors. Built fixtures and drawings need to be inspected and connection must be demonstrated to ensure that the keying is properly documented and implemented in the test equipment.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Operator Input Test Sequence Grouping
fields.description: All tests requiring operator input shall be grouped at the beginning or end of the test sequence, unless otherwise specified by the critical test order in the ATP.
fields.text3: This is a stakeholder requirement from MEEs in order to be able to optimize the workflow for a test technician who might be running tests on multiple test stations at the same time.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Test Prompt Clarity
fields.description:
Test Prompts shall be consistent, clear, and auditable throughout.

 

NOTE:

TE will make prompts clear as possible. TE will review with MEE and techs prior to wording finalization.

These conversations should take place during ATM creation.
fields.text3: The prompts need to be clear enough that any reasonable person can complete the instructions. In the past, there have existed test prompts that might reference unreleased or nonexistent documents. If a tool is required to perform an action, reference the tool. If a signal needs to be probed, where is it? If a cable needs to be plugged in, which cable, plugged into what and when. etc...
fields.validation_evidence$193: The source of this is the MEE. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Identification Markings
fields.description:
All Final/Top level test equipment shall have the corresponding part number, revision, and serial number clearly marked on the equipment per HRC-OPS-P-071.

 

NOTE: See HRC-ENG-I-001, Product Definition Preparation and Release, for marking and product definition instructions.
fields.text3: HRC-ENG-I-001, Product Definition Preparation and Release, for marking and product definition instructions.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Test Data Sheet Contents
fields.description:
The Test System Software shall produce a Test Data Sheet that contains the following information:

a. Product serial number at the sellable level of assembly.

b. Product revision level/status.

c. Product part number.

d. Test equipment software part number(s).

e. ATP revision level/status.

f. Calendar date test performed.

g. Quantitative values measured for each test step.

h. Pass/Fail criterial for each test step.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: UUT List
fields.description:
The Test System shall be capable of screening and programming the following UUTs.

CCA Part Number CCA Description
2600-0860-002 PCA, HPIO #1, HC
2600-0870-002 PCA, HPIO #2, HC
828-1A60-001 New HPIO
2600-1760-001 PCA, HC EGDP M6000
2600-1760-002 PCA, HEU EGDP M6500
2600-1370-006 Sensor Suite Controller
2600-1370-007 Sensor Suite Controller
828-1A62-002 LCD Controller
828-2A21-002 HCP Primary Board
fields.validation_evidence$193: The Bid includes all of these relevant UUTs. The requirement has been drafted according to the guidelines outlined in appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001.

fields.name: UUT Programming
fields.description:
The Test System shall program all files to the UUT according to the programming parameters tables and/or drawing notes indicated on the UUT drawings.

 

NOTE: Applicable UUTs are listed in the UUT List requirement.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The ability to program these CCAs is tied to the Bid document that is requesting the rehost for these controller Card Assemblies. The requirement has been drafted according to the guidelines outlined in appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001.

fields.name: Tier 1 Boundary Scan Coverage
fields.description:
The Test System shall be capable of performing Tier 1 Boundary Scan coverage of the UUT.

 

NOTE:

  • The descriptions for the various tiers are as described below and specific features may be articulated as decomposed requirements for different projects.

    • Tier 1:  Boundary Scan tests and programming accessible on the UUT only.  Typically requires simple connection of power and the JTAG bus to the UUT.  Actions that can be generated from the Bscan tool menu for Tier 1 level actions are Bscan chain check, interconnect screens between scannable devices on the chain, screens for memory devices accessible from a scannable device, and programming/configuration of memory devices accessible from a scannable device.

    • Tier 2:  External fixtured BScan I/O to expand coverage through edge connectors

    • Tier 3:  Everything else.  If you have to do scripting, cluster testing, non-bscan type sublevel elements are all Tier 3
fields.validation_evidence$193: This requirement would be outlined at bid time and so would have traceability to the bid slide deck. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Programming File CRC Check
fields.description: The Boundary Scan Software shall calculate and verify the CRC value of programming files that will be programmed into the UUT.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The requirement to verify CRC values of files programmed into the UUT comes from PROM Programming Process Specification 580-6049-001. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Boundary Scan Sequences
fields.description:
The Boundary Scan Test System shall include the following test/programming/troubleshooting sequences:

  • Sequence including all Erase, Program, Verify, and Test Actions.
fields.text3: Having the correct sequence information is useful.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The boundary scan sequences should come from the Manufacturing electrical engineer or production stakeholders. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: Boundary Scan Tool Software
fields.description:
The Boundary Scan Test System shall use XJTAG boundary scan software.

 

NOTE:

  • The three primary boundary scan tools used at Collins are XJTAG XJRunner, Asset Intertech ScanWorks, and JTAG Technologies Provision/AEX Manager.
fields.validation_evidence$193: The use of which boundary scan vendor software is typically determined at the bid phase and can be referenced there. In some cases, the decision may be made in the design plan to switch to a different tool in which case, the validation method should be linked to the design plan and potentially marked as engineering judgement. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

fields.name: IO CCA Required Connector Interface
fields.description: The test system shall Interface with either the 828-1A60-001 P6 or P2 connectors provide access for Test and JTAG Signals

Note: UUT - P1 =372-0486-010, Fixture Mate = RM322-182-241-5500
fields.validation_evidence$193: Power Requirements trace to the Software Load Procedure 946-1UE3-001. The requirement was written according to guidelines outlined in Appendix B of the requirements management plan 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
